Package algorithms.statistics

Class Standardization

java.lang.Object
algorithms.statistics.Standardization
public class Standardization extends Object
various methods for performing statistical standardization and de-normalization on a data. see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Normalization_(statistics) for more. TODO: add a non-isotropic scaling (see Hartley 1997, end of Section 5): transform points so that 1) Their centroid is at the origin. 2) The principal moments are both equal to unity
Author:
nichole

  • Constructor Details

    • Standardization

      public Standardization()

  • Method Details

    • standardUnitNormalization

      public static double[] standardUnitNormalization(double[] data, int nDimensions, double[] outputMean, double[] outputStandardDeviation)
      performs "standard unit normalization" on the points, that is, transforms the data to have a mean of 0 and a standard deviation of 1 (unit variance) for each dimension.
      Parameters:
      data - nDimensional data points in format [ point_0 in all dimensions, point_1 in all dimensions, ... point_{n-1} in all dimensions[
      nDimensions - the number of dimensions of a point
      outputMean - the mean of the input data per dimension
      outputStandardDeviation - the standard deviation of the mean subtracted data per dimension.
      Returns:
      an array holding the standardized data in format of data array, e.g. point_0_0, point_0_1, point_0_2...point_0_{nDimensions-1}]. Note that the results should have a mean of 0 and a standard deviation of 1 or 0.

    • standardUnitDenormalization

      public static double[] standardUnitDenormalization(double[] data, int nDimensions, double[] mean, double[] standardDeviation)
      performs de-normalization per dimension on data that has been standardized with "standard unit normalization", that is, multiplies by the given standardDeviation and adds the given mean. for each dimension.
      Parameters:
      data - nDimensional data points in format [ point_0 in all dimensions, point_1 in all dimensions, ... point_{n-1} in all dimensions[
      nDimensions - the number of dimensions of a point
      mean - the mean of the unnormalized input data per dimension
      standardDeviation - the standard deviation of the mean subtracted unnormalized data per dimension.
      Returns:
      an array holding the de-normalized data in format similar to data array.

    • unitStandardNormalizeImage

      public static double[] unitStandardNormalizeImage(double[][] im)
      unit standard normalize data and return the mean and standard deviation of the zero-centered data.
      Parameters:
      im -
      Returns:
      the mean and standard deviation of zero-centered data

    • minMaxNormalizeImage

      public static double[] minMaxNormalizeImage(double[][] im)
      apply min max normalization to image and return the min and max. The operation changes the data values so that they are all in range [0, 1].
      Parameters:
      im -
      Returns:
      the mean and standard deviation of zero-centered data

    • minMaxNormalizeImage

      public static void minMaxNormalizeImage(double[][] im, double min, double max)
      apply min max normalization to image, given the min and max. useful if need to apply same normalization to different dataset. note that if data is < min, it is set to 0.
      Parameters:
      im -

    • applyMeanAndStdToImage

      public static void applyMeanAndStdToImage(double[][] im, double mean, double std)
      subtract mean from data then divide by std. used to perform same normalization on different images.
      Parameters:
      im -
      the - mean to subtract from data
      the - standard deviation to divide data by

    • standardUnitNormalization

      public static double[][] standardUnitNormalization(double[][] data, double[] outputMean, double[] outputStandardDeviation)
      performs "standard unit normalization" on the points, that is, transforms the data to have a mean of 0 and a standard deviation of 1 (unit variance) for each dimension. the input data must have format [nSamples][nVariables], e.g. data[0] = [10, 100, 1000]; data[1] = [9, 101, 999]; for nSamples=2 and nVariables = 3;
      Parameters:
      data - the input data must have format [nSamples][nVariables], e.g. data[0] = [10, 100, 1000]; data[1] = [9, 101, 999]; for nSamples=2 and nVariables = 3;
      outputMean - the mean of the input data per variable (a.k.a. dimension)
      outputStandardDeviation - the standard deviation of the mean subtracted data per dimension.
      Returns:
      an array holding (data - mean)/stdev

    • zeroCenterMean

      public static double[][] zeroCenterMean(double[][] data)
      calculate the mean of each column of data and subtract it from each value in the respective column of data.
      Parameters:
      data -
      Returns:
